question: Hotel Mondial.
answer: Le Mondial. Tres bien. Avec cette pluie ca risque de prendre un moment. L'autoroute est ferme. A cause du 14 Juillet.

question: I don't speak French.
answer: Ah. American?

question: That's right.
answer: That's good because I speak a little English. I asked if you mind the radio. Music. You know. Super cool.

question: What time is it?
answer: Time, time, time. I don't know. Daytime. Are you in town for business?

question: Yes.
answer: It's a nice hotel. Your hotel. Very big rooms. Do you know Paris?

question: I've been here once before. When I was younger.
answer: Those were the days. Married?

question: I beg your pardon?
answer: Do you have a wife?

question: No. Why?
answer: Well, if you need a wife for the night... Une escorte. Pour vous faire visiter. For business. I give you my number. Very nice girl. French. Like when you were young. Know what I mean? Speaks the language of love. Take you to heaven and back. You just tell me and I set it up. What you laughing at? You let Moises set it up. She treat you right. She treat you fine.

question: Your package...It arrived in the last night of before last night. Ah...telephone, for the room service. The toilet. To hang the clothes. From here you can operate the television. Merci.
answer: Oh, wait. What time is it?

question: What time is it?
answer: Time.

question: Bonjour.
answer: Bonjour.

question: Wow. Vous avez une belle chambre. Je ne suis jamais venue dans cet hotel. Ca sera 150 francs de l'heure. Toute la nuit pour 700. D'avance. Et faudra porter un--
answer: I...don't speak French.

question: It's okay. It will be one thousand francs for all night. In advance. We can do it now if you want.
answer: Well, let me just dry up.

question: Okay, but it's not necessary.
answer: What's your name?

question: Zoe or Zoey. Which ever you like.
answer: My name's Zed.

question: That's funny. We both have Z names.
answer: What was that?

question: You can take those off. The pants.
answer: I'd rather watch you get undressed first.

question: Alright.
answer: Slower.

question: Alright Mister America. Zed. Slow enough for you? C'etait formidable. I'm cold. Zed?
answer: Yes?

question: Moises told me you were in town for business.
answer: Yes.

question: What kind of business?
answer: Why?

question: I don't know. I'm just curious.
answer: Do you ask all your clients questions?

question: No. Just the ones I like.
answer: So you like me?

question: Yes.
answer: Why?

question: Because you're...a good person. I run into some real creeps. You know.
answer: How do you know I'm a good person?

question: Body language. We fit together.
answer: All men and women fit together. Hell, even some men fit together.

question: No, but you know, we clicked. You made me orgasm. Do you know how often I orgasm with a man Moises sets me up with?
answer: No I don't.

question: Usually never. They're almost always fat like pigs. And you make me feel safe. That's something more important than the orgasm. An integral part maybe of the orgasm.
answer: I never really thought of it like that.

question: Well, it's true. Turn off the television. So I mean it when I tell you Zed, I like you very much.
answer: Well, I like you too Zoe.

question: Honest? Why? For the same reason? Any man can orgasm. Even with his own hand.
answer: Well, I like your honesty. You're open. Unlike most prostitutes I've been with.

question: I am not a prostitute!
answer: Really? Can I have my francs back then?

question: I'm a student. And to pay for the classes I became an escort. It's my choice to sleep with you.
answer: I see.

question: What? You don't understand.
answer: No, I do.

question: Hey, it's not easy.
answer: I didn't say it was.

question: I'm here because I want to.
answer: Okay, okay relax. What school do you go to?

question: The Centre du Art, Paris.
answer: That's really interesting. What kind of art do you study?

question: Not any of the old shit.
answer: Oh.

question: I have a day job too. Three times a week. But someday there will be only my art.
answer: What kind of things do you paint?

question: I don't paint. I make things. Objects. Not like sculpture. Like life...but with no narrative. I want when someone looks at one of my objects for there to be no reference to the world. Void of feeling, emotion...void of destiny. Those are left for me. They belong only to me. If someone else can see into it...then it is no longer mine. I have failed. And I would destroy it. I don't care how much cash they would offer me. It would be shit. I can't tell you how many objects of mine have been destroyed. They told too much about me. And if someone wants to know something about me...I'll tell them myself. The way I'm telling you. What I do I do only for the objects.
answer: I'd like to see one of these.

question: What? So you could see the work of a whore?
answer: Zoey. I'm sorry for calling you a prostitute. I didn't understand the difference.

question: The difference is a prostitute would have lied to you about her orgasm.
answer: If these things you make are as true as you are...I'm sure they're as indescribable. Perhaps, someday, you'll make one...about me.

question: If I do...you'll never know which one it is. Because I'll be the only one who understands. I'll be the only one who can look into it and see where in my life it came from. What time is it?
answer: I have no idea. Night time.

question: Hey you madman!
answer: Eric. Come in.

question: What happened to you? I thought you were going to call. Oh I see. You have been busy.
answer: Sorry, I asked the hotel to give me a wake up call.

question: That's good, but now I am here. So let's go. We have a lot to talk about.
answer: What about the girl?

question: Is she your girlfriend?
answer: No.

question: Fuck her. She's a dishrag whore. Kick her out.
answer: I'll let her stay here tonight.

question: Don't be silly. It's dangerous.
answer: Eric.

question: Don't worry about her. God damn it! God damn it. Look at my hand.
answer: Jesus Eric.

question: Ouvres! Je veux mes habits!
answer: Oh shit. Her clothes.

question: Tu te prends pour qui espece de connard!?
answer: La ferme! So tell me, what have you been up to?

question: Eric, I liked that girl.
answer: Oh. Well, then why didn't you stop me.

question: Because you were on a rampage.
answer: Look, your whole life you've done nothing but fuck whores. A girl like that will give you AIDS. Why don't you find a nice girl in the suburbs?

question: Because when you need to get off you don't want to have to date for months to do it.
answer: Just use your hand like me.

question: Sometimes you just need honesty...and security.
answer: I don't understand. Anyway, it's too late. Get dressed, let's go out and meet the boys.

question: Okay, let me take a shower.
answer: No, in Paris it's good to smell like you've been fucking. It will make them respect you.

question: Oh.
answer: Just put on a shirt and a sport coat.

question: I'm glad you came. How long has it been?
answer: Years.

question: It's amazing, you know? Here you are. One day in America. Now here.
answer: Well, to be honest there really wasn't much happening for me in the states.

question: But in Paris your old friend Eric has a job for you, so you came. That's good.
answer: How could I resist your invitation?

question: You would have been stupid to.
answer: So what have you been doing here?

question: After school I spent some time in Algeria studying African philosophy. And then I bummed around. You know. For fun. For a while I worked at Le Figaro. The newspaper.
answer: Really?

question: Yes. With an assumed Masters degree. And lately we have just been bombing fascists here in Paris. You know, like terrorists. It's fun. The people next door are on holiday. We took their phone. If you want to make a long distance call, go ahead.
answer: Is that cat dead?

question: Thanks.
answer: Don't ask me where we got this.

question: Okay.
answer: On Bastille Day, all the banks are closed. But this one. BIP. The Banque Internationale de Paris. And for being greedy capitalists perhaps they will remain closed next Bastille day. Yes? We will go in and shut the bank down. Now, look at this. As you can see, only one person can start the alarm. The concierge, at this desk. We will take care of him. Then we can close the bank. No one will know the difference since every other bank will be closed.

question: Are you sure he won't push the alarm?
answer: Ahhh! He's right next to the door. We'd have to be totally incompetent not to stop him. Don't worry about that. Here. This is where they keep the days reserve cash. Okay fuck that. There are many vaults downstairs, but this is the vault we must get into. This is where the real prize is.

question: What kind of vault is that?
answer: Ah...Swiss made. A Caliber.

question: Caliber? It'll take three hours.
answer: No, that's too long.

question: That's how long it'll take.
answer: Well shit. It's too long. We have to be in and out. Like that. Or there will be suspicion. A little time is okay...but too long and...

question: Well hold on a second. What's this?
answer: Another vault.

question: No this.
answer: I don't know...it connects the two vaults.

question: Well, what kind of vault is this other one?
answer: Also Swiss, but this one is a Poseidon.

question: Why would those two vaults be connected?
answer: I don't know.

question: Because I can get into this vault in half an hour. Maybe less.
answer: But this entry way is too small to get the platen out. We have a lot of merchandise in there.

question: No, don't you see? We get in through this secondary vault and take this passage to the other main vault. From the inside I could open the Caliber vault in five minutes.
answer: You could open it in five minutes?

question: From the inside it's easy.
answer: Hot damn. That is our answer.

question: Okay. When is Bastille day?
answer: Tomorrow.

question: Tomorrow!? We're doing this tomorrow?
answer: But of course.

question: It's impossible.
answer: It's not impossible. Everyone knows what to do.

question: I don't know what to do.
answer: You don't need to know shit. Just get into the vault and we'll do the rest.

question: I haven't even seen the bank.
answer: Fuck the bank. Before we do a job we live life. It's better that way. Okay?

question: Okay.
answer: Good. Now we do heroin!

question: So, how long have you known Eric?
answer: Well, Eric's mother is American.

question: Yeah, and his dad's French.
answer: They're divorced. And she and his father had some kind of six month split plan set up. So every six months he would come back to the states. We were best friends. Eventually he and his mother had a falling out and he stayed here. It's been...years.

question: Well, it's good to have you here. Eric speaks fairly highly of you. Say, he says you're a big fan of Viking films.
answer: Well...I suppose. I used to be, when I was young.

question: Oh they're the best. Helmets with horns on them. Shit. That's fucking genius. How 'bout Toy Jazz? You like it?
answer: Yeah...I guess.

question: I love it. It's really good, you know? Like real music. It has a heart and culture all it's own. It's, like, jazz for dwarves...or guys in Leiderhosen. Total purity of essence.
answer: Yeah.

answer: Zed opens up his steel briefcase. Inside of it are all sorts of electronic gear and tools. Zed takes a power drill out from the briefcase and attaches a special diamond tipped bit. He measures the depth he wants to drill to and then marks the bit with a yellow pencil. Zed starts drilling into the point he marked with the chalk on the vault door.

question: Zoey is sitting on the floor next to the other bank hostages.
answer: EXTREME CLOSE ON
